notes.text:
An update for firefox is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, designed for standards compliance, performance, and portability.

This update upgrades Firefox to version 115.10.0 ESR.

Security Fix(es):
  
* GetBoundName in the JIT returned the wrong object (CVE-2024-3852)

* Out-of-bounds-read after mis-optimized switch statement (CVE-2024-3854)

* Incorrect JITting of arguments led to use-after-free during garbage collection (CVE-2024-3857)

* Permission prompt input delay could expire when not in focus (CVE-2024-2609)

* Integer-overflow led to out-of-bounds-read in the OpenType sanitizer (CVE-2024-3859)

* Potential use-after-free due to AlignedBuffer self-move (CVE-2024-3861)

* Memory safety bug fixed in Firefox 125, Firefox ESR 115.10, and Thunderbird 115.10 (CVE-2024-3864)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Product UI does not Warn User of Unsafe Actions

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

The permission prompt input delay could expire while the window is not in focus. This makes it vulnerable to clickjacking by malicious websites.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Permission prompt input delay could expire when not in focus
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Permission prompt input delay could expire when not in focus

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

There was no limit to the number of HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames that would be processed. A server could abuse this to create an Out of Memory condition in the browser.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Denial of Service using HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Denial of Service using HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames

cwe.name: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

GetBoundName could return the wrong version of an object when JIT optimizations were applied.

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

In some code patterns the JIT incorrectly optimized switch statements and generated code with out-of-bounds-reads.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Out-of-bounds-read after mis-optimized switch statement

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

The JIT created incorrect code for arguments in certain cases. This led to potential use-after-free crashes during garbage collection.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Incorrect JITting of arguments led to use-after-free during garbage collection

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Incorrect JITting of arguments led to use-after-free during garbage collection

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

On 32-bit versions there were integer-overflows that led to an out-of-bounds-read that potentially could be triggered by a malformed OpenType font.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Integer-overflow led to out-of-bounds-read in the OpenType sanitizer
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Integer-overflow led to out-of-bounds-read in the OpenType sanitizer

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

If an AlignedBuffer were assigned to itself, the subsequent self-move could result in an incorrect reference count and later use-after-free.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Potential use-after-free due to AlignedBuffer self-move
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Potential use-after-free due to AlignedBuffer self-move

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Memory safety bug present in Firefox 124, Firefox ESR 115.9, and Thunderbird 115.9. This bug showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort this could have been exploited to run arbitrary code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Memory safety bug fixed in Firefox 125, Firefox ESR 115.10, and Thunderbird 115.10
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat Product Security rates the severity of this flaw as determined by the Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory.

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.
